pathbench.benchmarking

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.balance_dataset(dataset: Dataset, task: str, config: dict)[source]

Determine the balancing strategy based on the task amd apply balancing

Parameters:

  • dataset – The training dataset

  • task – The task

  • config – The configuration dictionary

Returns:

The balanced dataset

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.benchmark(config, project)[source]

Main benchmarking script, which runs the benchmarking based on the configuration

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • project – The project

Returns:

None

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.build_aggregated_results(val_df: DataFrame, test_df: DataFrame, config: dict, benchmark_parameters: dict, aggregation_functions: dict)[source]

Aggregate the results across splits, based on the relevant metric for each task

Parameters:

  • val_df – The validation results dataframe

  • test_df – The test results dataframe

  • benchmark_parameters – The benchmark parameters

  • aggregation_functions – The aggregation functions

Returns:

The aggregated validation results dataframe and the aggregated test results dataframe

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.calculate_brier_score(durations: array, events: array, predictions: array)[source]

Calculate the Brier score based on the durations, events and predictions

Parameters:

  • durations – The durations

  • events – The events

  • predictions – The predictions

Returns:

The Brier score

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.calculate_combinations(config: dict)[source]

Calculate all combinations based on the benchmark parameters in the configuration

Parameters:

config – The configuration dictionary

Returns:

The list of all combinations

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.calculate_results(result: DataFrame, config: dict, save_string: str, dataset_type: str)[source]

Calculate the results based on the configuration, given the results dataframe and the task.

Parameters:

  • result – The results dataframe

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • save_string – The save string

Returns:

The metrics, true positive rate, false positive rate and precision-recall curves

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.calculate_survival_results(result: DataFrame)[source]

Calculate the survival results based on the configuration, given the results dataframe

Parameters:

result – The results dataframe

Returns:

The metrics, durations, events and predictions

  • project_directory – The project directory

  • config – The configuration dictionary

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.find_and_apply_best_model(config: dict, val_df_agg: DataFrame, test_df_agg: DataFrame, benchmark_parameters: dict, val_df: DataFrame, test_df: DataFrame, val: Dataset, test: Dataset, target: str)[source]

Find and apply the best model based on the relevant metric for each task

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • val_df_agg – The aggregated validation results dataframe

  • test_df_agg – The aggregated test results dataframe

  • benchmark_parameters – The benchmark parameters

  • val_df – The validation results dataframe

  • test_df – The test results dataframe

  • target – The target variable

Returns:

None

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.generate_bags(config: dict, project: Project, all_data: Dataset, combination_dict: dict, string_without_mil: str, feature_extractor)[source]

Generate feature bags based on the configuration

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • project – The project

  • all_data – The dataset

  • combination_dict – The combination dictionary

  • string_without_mil – The string without the MIL method

  • feature_extractor – The feature extractor

Returns:

The feature bags

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.load_class(module_name, class_name)[source]
pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.optimize_parameters(config, project)[source]
pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.plot_across_splits(config: dict, survival_results_per_split: list, test_survival_results_per_split: list, val_results_per_split: list, test_results_per_split: list, val_pr_per_split: list, test_pr_per_split: list, save_string: str)[source]

Plot the results across splits, depending on the task

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • survival_results_per_split – The survival results per split, only relevant for survival task

  • test_survival_results_per_split – The test survival results per split, only relevant for survival task

  • val_results_per_split – The validation results per split

  • test_results_per_split – The test results per split

  • val_pr_per_split – The validation precision-recall curves per split, only relevant for classification

  • test_pr_per_split – The test precision-recall curves per split, only relevant for classification

  • save_string – The save string

Returns:

None

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.run_best_model(config: dict, split: int, dataset: Dataset, bags: str, mil_conf: dict, target: str, model_weights: str)[source]

Run the best model based on the configuration, including heatmaps

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • split – The split

  • dataset – The dataset

  • bags – The bags

  • mil_conf – The MIL configuration

  • target – The target variable

  • model_weights – Path to the model weights

Returns:

None

config – The configuration dictionary

The updated configuration, evaluation metrics and aggregation functions

  • combination_dict – The combination dictionary

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.should_continue(config: dict, all_combinations: list)[source]

Check if the benchmarking should continue based on the finished combinations

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • all_combinations – The list of all combinations

Returns:

A boolean indicating whether the benchmarking should continue, the filtered list of all combinations, the validation results and the test results all_combinations: The filtered list of all combinations val_df: The validation results dataframe test_df: The test results dataframe

pathbench.benchmarking.benchmark.split_datasets(config: dict, project: Project, splits_file: str, target: str, project_directory: str, train_set: Dataset)[source]

Split the datasets based on the configuration

Parameters:

  • config – The configuration dictionary

  • project – The project

  • splits_file – The splits file

  • target – The target variable

  • project_directory – The project directory

  • train_set – The training dataset

Returns:

The splits
